Class TandemQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • TandemQueue

  •  class TandemQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the Tandem Queue used in exercise 1.4
    Author:
    gabriel c-parent

      Constructor and Description
      TandemQueue(int m, double arrivalRate, int[] queueCapacities, double[] serviceRates)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumberOfServers()
      get the number of servers in the queueing system
      void simulateFixedNumber(umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen1, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen2, int numberOfClients, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] waitingTally, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] blockingTally)
      Simulates a tandem queue with fixed number of clients in the system.
      void simulateFixedTime(umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen1, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen2, double timeCutoff, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] waitingTimes, umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] blockedTimes)
      Simulates a tandem queue with fixed number of clients in the system, which we infer the number by precalculating the arrivals.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TandemQueue

        public TandemQueue(int m,
           double arrivalRate,
           int[] queueCapacities,
           double[] serviceRates)
        Tandem Queue constructor
        Parameters:
        arrivalRate - arrival rate of clients from the origin. exponential distribution with mean 1/lambda.
        queueCapacities - capacity of each queues excluding the origin (infinite)
        serviceTimes - service time for each server excluding the origin. exponential distribution with mean 1 / serviceTimes[i].

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfServers

        public int getNumberOfServers()
        get the number of servers in the queueing system
        Returns:
        number of servers

      • simulateFixedNumber

        public void simulateFixedNumber(umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen1,
                       umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen2,
                       int numberOfClients,
                       umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] waitingTally,
                       umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] blockingTally)
        Simulates a tandem queue with fixed number of clients in the system. The first generator is used to generate the arrival times of the clients in the system and then the simulateSystem method is called.
        Parameters:
        gen1 - first generator, instance of a RandomStreamBase
        gen2 - second generator, instance of a RandomStreamBase
        numberOfClients - number of clients in the system

      • simulateFixedTime

        public void simulateFixedTime(umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen1,
                     umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStreamBase gen2,
                     double timeCutoff,
                     umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] waitingTimes,
                     umontreal.iro.lecuyer.stat.Tally[] blockedTimes)
        Simulates a tandem queue with fixed number of clients in the system, which we infer the number by precalculating the arrivals. The first generator is used to generate the arrival times of the clients in the system and then the simulateSystem method is called.
        Parameters:
        gen1 - first generator, instance of a RandomStreamBase
        gen2 - second generator, instance of a RandomStreamBase
        numberOfClients - number of clients in the system
